contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox VG |title=XII Stag |collapsible=yes |image=[[Image:XII Stag cover PAL.jpg|256px]] |caption= |developer=[[Triangle Service]] (arcade)<br> Dreams (PS2) |publisher={{vgrelease|JP=[[Taito]] (arcade, PS2)}} {{vgrelease|EU=[[505 Game Street]] (PS2)}} |distributor={{vgrelease|EU=[[Digital Bros]] (PS2)}} |designer = |series= |engine=LightWave |version = |released ={{vgrelease|JP=2002 (arcade)}} {{vgrelease|JP=20 March 2003 (PS2)}} {{vgrelease|EU=2 April 2004 (PS2)}} |genre = [[Shoot 'em up]] |modes = [[Single player]], [[Multiplayer]] |ratings = |platforms = [[Arcade Game|Arcade]], [[PlayStation 2]] |media = |requirements =PS2: 50kB memory blocks |input = |cabinet = |arcade system = Taito G-NET [http://www.system16.com/hardware.php?id=672] |cpu = MIPS [[R3000A]] |sound = [[Panasonic]] MN1020012A TMS57002 |display = }} '''''XII Stag''''' (pronounced ''Twelve Stag''), is a [[shoot 'em up]] [[arcade game]] developed by [[Triangle Service]] and published by [[Taito Corporation|Taito]]. It run originally in Taito's [[G-NET]] arcade board, and was ported to the [[PlayStation 2]] console. [[Digital Bros]] published the port in Europe; however, the game was not released in the USA. ==XIIstag Limited== {{Infobox VG |title=XIISTAG LIMITED |collapsible=yes |image= |caption= |developer=[[Triangle Service]] |publisher=[[Triangle Service]] |distributor= |series= |engine=LightWave |designer= |version=0.55 |released=2005-? |genre= [[Shoot 'em up]] |modes= [[Single player]], [[Multiplayer]] |ratings = |platforms =[[Windows 95]] |media = |requirements =Pentium MMX-comptible CPU, sound card |input = |cabinet = |arcade system = |cpu = |sound = |display = }} It is a 1-stage demo of the game that includes Stage 4 of the original game. Full-screen and windowed executables are included. Unlike the original, the objects are 3d objects rendered in software. ==XIIZeal== {{Infobox VG |title=XIIZeal |collapsible=yes |image= |caption= |developer=[[Eurosoft]] |publisher=[[Eurosoft]]<br> {{vgrelease|JP=[[Triangle Service]]}} |distributor=[[Clickgamer]]<br> {{vgrelease|JP=gameZanmai.com ([[Idea Factory]])}} |series= |engine=LightWave |designer= |version=1.0 (demo) |released=2007-?<br> {{vgrelease|JP=28 December 2006}} |genre= [[Shoot 'em up]] |modes= [[Single player]], [[Multiplayer]] |ratings = |platforms =[[Windows Mobile]] |media = |requirements = |input = |cabinet = |arcade system = |cpu = |sound = |display = }} It is a version for Windows Mobile platform. It includes 5 difficulty settings from very easy to very hard, original soundtrack. ==Game play== ===Attacks=== *Normal shot: Press A. There are 5 shot levels. *Barrier: Press B. Consumes 1 bomb. *Side attack LEVEL1: Tap horizontal direction once, then opposite direction. *Side attack LEVEL2: right, left, left or left, right, right *Back fire attack: When enemy is close to the rear of player's fighter, enemy is automatically damaged. ===Multiplier system=== When enemy is destroyed by Side attack or Back fire attack, the current score multiplier increases by 1, up to 12. The multiplier decreases by 1 at a time when enemy is not destroyed by either attack for a prolonged time period. ==External links== ===XIIStag=== *[http://www.triangleservice.co.jp/html/xiistag/index.html Triangle service page] *[http://www.triangleservice.co.jp/html/xiistag/index.html Triangle service XIISTAG LIMITED page] *{{ja icon}} [http://web.archive.org/web/20070304075258/http://www.taito.co.jp/d3/cp/12stag/ Taito PS2 page] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20070828192114/http://www.taito.co.jp/game/history/2000/ac_360.html Taito history page] *[http://www.hcn.zaq.ne.jp/rydeen/12stag/main.html XIIStag strategy guide] *[http://www.ntsc-uk.com/review.php?platform=ps2&game=XIIStag NTSC-uk review] ===XIIZeal=== *[http://www.triangleservice.co.jp/html/xiistag/ppc/index.html Triangle Service page] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20110718125808/http://xiizeal.com/ XIIZeal site] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20110719042152/http://www.gamezanmai.com/gameintr_4.htm Gamezanmai page] {{DEFAULTSORT:Xii Stag}} [[Category:2002 video games]] [[Category:2003 video games]] [[Category:2004 video games]] [[Category:2005 video games]] [[Category:2006 video games]] [[Category:2007 video games]] [[Category:PlayStation 2 games]] [[Category:Taito games]] {{Taito-videogame-stub}} {{shmup-videogame-stub}}
